member.name: IDirect3DBaseTexture9.GetAutoGenFilterType
member.summary: Get the filter type that is used for automatically generated mipmap sublevels.
member.returns: Filter type. See D3DTEXTUREFILTERTYPE. A texture must be created with D3DUSAGE_AUTOGENMIPMAP to use this method. Any other usage value will cause this method to return D3DTEXF_NONE.

member.name: IDirect3DBaseTexture9.GetLevelCount
member.summary: Returns the number of texture levels in a multilevel texture.
member.returns: A DWORD value that indicates the number of texture levels in a multilevel texture.

member.name: IDirect3DBaseTexture9.GetLOD
member.summary: Returns a value clamped to the maximum level-of-detail set for a managed texture (this method is not supported for an unmanaged texture).
member.returns: A DWORD value, clamped to the maximum level-of-detail value (one less than the total number of levels). Calling GetLOD on an unmanaged texture is not supported and will result in a D3DERR error code being returned.

member.name: IDirect3DBaseTexture9.SetAutoGenFilterType
member.summary: Set the filter type that is used for automatically generated mipmap sublevels.
member.param: Filter type. See D3DTEXTUREFILTERTYPE. This method will fail if the filter type is invalid or not supported.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DBaseTexture9.SetLOD
member.summary: Sets the most detailed level-of-detail for a managed texture.
member.param: Most detailed level-of-detail value to set for the mipmap chain.
member.returns: A DWORD value, clamped to the maximum level-of-detail value (one less than the total number of levels). Subsequent calls to this method will return the clamped value, not the level-of-detail value that was previously set.

member.name: IDirect3DBaseTexture9
member.summary: Applications use the methods of the IDirect3DBaseTexture9 interface to manipulate texture resources including cube and volume textures.
